elements.title: Gyula Bajó
elements.contents: ... that Hungarians Gyula Bajó and Endre Hevizi, who went on to design stained glass (example pictured) for the Debre Libanos monastery, worked as labourers in a British pottery after the Second World War?

elements.title: Cameron Cutie
elements.contents: ... that the mayor of Antrim, Adrian Watson, said that he was overlooked for not being a "Cameron Cutie"?

elements.title: Samuel Rajzman
elements.contents: ... that Holocaust survivor Samuel Rajzman, a witness to the post-war Nuremberg and Treblinka trials, escaped from Treblinka concentration camp and was then sheltered by a local Polish farmer?

elements.title: Occult America
elements.contents: ... that Occult America suggests that Abraham Lincoln may have turned to Spiritualism after the death of his son?

elements.title: Simón
elements.contents: ... that due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the nightclub scene in Simón used only 30 extras instead of the originally intended 250?

elements.title: Haggai Chisom Ndubuisi
elements.contents: ... that Haggai Chisom Ndubuisi, a National Football League player, had never heard of American football before watching a YouTube video when he was 18 years old?

elements.title: Jewish astrology
elements.contents: ... that while the laws governing Jewish astrology prohibit worshipping the stars, gaining knowledge of their influences on humans is permitted?

elements.title: Battle of Lewinsville
elements.contents: ... that after the Battle of Lewinsville, the "Gray Ghost" wrote that he regretted "the glorious opportunity that I missed of winging their colonel"?
